string.text:
The Nostromo touches down on the planetoid and its heavy engines whirr down to silence.
You sit in the airlock chamber, poised for action.
A rattle of dust and debris whips across the airlock door infront of you.
What wonders could await at the beacon?
The airlock chamber is a sterile place. Around you is your spacesuit and the door to the outside. A red light pulses gently and the hum of the ships systems tickles your ears.

The airlock doors whirr into life and thud open in the new pressure of the planetoid's environment.
You step out.
The airlock hasn't been primed. The pressure difference will tear the ship apart, and kill you in the process.

You are already wearing your spacesuit.
Quit stalling!
You pick up your spacesuit's helmet and click it into place. The world becomes muffled and you can feel your heart beating to the pulse of the red light above the airlock doors.
You aren't wearing your spacesuit. The change in pressure will cause servere damage to your vital organs.
Through your suit you feel a change in pressure as the pulse of the red light increases. There is a burst of white smoke and the light calms again.

You step outside the airlock.
Wind whistles across your visor, and the sound of flying rubble fills your ears through the muffled suit.
Just in front of you is the derelict, and behind you is the airlock you just left.
You feel alone with your thoughts in this harsh place.

You look out across the vast nothing, and into the fog.
Wind whips debris across the land infront of you, which is pulled in twisted shapes and formations from the harsh conditions.
Just infront of you is the derelict ship, you can see what looks like an entrance to it.
